result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Burks to serve 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Columbia in the amount of $5,576.90 (joint and several with Co-Actors of the cases)

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 10% restitution surcharge

--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay $10 drug offender diversion surcharge

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall

Arresting Agency: Johnson Creek PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
06/24/16: With no objection from Mr. Burks, the Court amends the JOC to include in the conditions of extended supervison that Mr. Burks is to pay $784 in extradition fees.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:10pm
Defendant Nicholas R Burks appears via video conferencing from the Kenosha Corr. Center, in custody..   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

With no objection from Mr. Burks, the Court amends the JOC to include in the conditions of extended supervison that Mr. Burks is to pay $784 in extradition fees.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF103 and 15CF170 called together at 10:29am [mo]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest  " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Burks  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Case 15CF170

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Burks

The Court sentences Mr. Burks to serve 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives 59 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution to Columbia in the amount of $5,576.90(joint and several with Co-Actors of the cases)

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 10:41am

Cases 15CF103 & 15CF170 called together at 8:45 am [Clerk SH] (On Defense Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Nicholas R Burks in court, in-custody, with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell confirms that Mr. Burks is only in-custody on bond that he can not post
Arguments presented; Court presents basis and AMENDS cash bond and RAISES CASH BOND TO $20,000 TO cover BOTH FILES, with non-monetary conditions to remain the same.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Zarwell indicates that scheduling may remain as currently is
Recess: 8:53 am

NEXT: (1) Cases to remain as scheduled
Defendant appeared in-custody // Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Cases 15CF103 & 15CF170 called together at 1:24 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney David Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

15CF170: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 CASH bond, to cover BOTH files, with non-monetary conditions to continue as previously ordered.
Recess: 1:30 pm 

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 11/25/15 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 12/17/15 at 9:45 am - Send notices

Cases 15CF103 and 15CF170 called together at 3:43pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
[15CF170 scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance and 15CF103 scheduled for STC]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks does not appear in court. Attorney David Zarwell appears in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber orally motions for an arrest warrant
Atty. Zarwell indicates that he has been unable to contact Mr. Burks, but Mr. Burks has attended all prior hearings


The Court orders that Mr. Burks be produced to the Branch IV Court prior to 8/4/2015 at 9:00am, if he does not appear/ Atty. Zarwell does not arrange a hearing, then a bench warrant shall be issued for Mr. Burks and bond will be in forfeiture.
recess: 3:48pm

Cases 15CF103 & 15CF170 called together at 1:53 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: Appear on 15CF103 case only, counsel has not yet been appointed on 15CF170
Mr. Burks informs the Court that he would like counsel in new matter before proceeding

15CF170:
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with co-defendant-Montrelle Lock or Samantha Zubke, Tiffany Steward, Maurese Gee
-No presence at Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
-Booking at JESO

As to 15CF103: Requests matter be set for STC at same date/time as adjourned initial
Recess: 2:01 pm

NEXT: (1) 15CF103: (2) STC scheduled for at 7/31/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices 15CF170: (2) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 7/31/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference on July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 08:40 am.

Cases 15CF103 & 15CF111 called together at 9:22 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks in court with Attorney David Zarwell (15CF103). Defendant Dominic D McCovery in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel (15CF11). ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES: 
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds each Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
ADA Hall expresses concerns about no contact provisions in both defendants bond, presents basis - Court reminds Defendants of No Contact Provisions
Recess: 9:29 am 

NEXT: 15CF103: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/17/15 at 8:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
15CF111: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/17/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Co-Defendants' cases #15CF103, #15CF111,#15CF113 called briefly at at 9:17, and then at 9:49am. 
Co-Defendant Nicholas Burks does not appear.  His counsel, Attorney David Zarwell, is in court.
Co-Defendant Dominic D. McCovery in court with Attorney John V. Rhiel
Co-Defendant Courtney Stewart in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.


As to #15CF103: 
--Mr. Burks has been in contact with court staff and Attorney Zarwell to say he is delayed in traveling here. The Court and parties have been awaiting his arrival.
--recess 9:59am, reconvene 10:09am. Mr. Burks now appears.
--Mr.  Burks waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files the Information. 
--the Court will schedule Arraignment on a later date. 

As to #15CF111: 
--Mr. McCovery waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files the Information. 
--Attorney Rhiel requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.
--the Court modifies the Bond to add a clarification that : as long as any contact is through a third person, there may be contact for the purposes of arranging placement and visitations with the children, however this third-person contact is to involve no discussion of matters other than the logistics of the visitation, not about anything else, including that there is not to be any discussion about this case. 

As to #15CF113:
--On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the case as to Co-Defendant Stewart. 
--The Court releases Ms. Stewart from the Bond and its conditions. 
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess 10:20am. 

NEXT:  (1) case dismissal as to Case #15CF133- Stewart  (2) schedule Arraignment on Co-Defendants #15CF103 and #15CF111 on 5/4/15 at 4:00pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 1:32pm. 
Defendant Nicholas R. Burks appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Burks verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Counsel agree to the scheduling of the Preliminary Hearing on April 20th. 

The Court requires a $5,000  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Courtney Stewart, Dominic McCovery
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--acts or threats of violence
recess 1:34pm. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 4/20/15 at 9:00am.
